bestPractices: Don't navigate them away from your funnel.
Have a CTA button such as 'Start Now'
Use a sticky bar it improves the visitors experience.
There are unique situations where you want to include extra links such as docs for developers.
Boldy state your unique selling point.
Have a call to action such as 'Start Now'.
Use an image/video of your application or abstract art that shows value and/or makes it easier to understand the product.
Included your target audience in the the header or sub-header.
Avoid using off the page links unless it's part of the funnel.

bestPractices: Use the most known logos you have.
Add metrics such as customers, companies or a unique property of your company.
Have a CTA to case studies if you have them.
Use action oriented words.
Use contrasting colors, make it stand out!
Don't use vague language such as try it out
Use language that invokes interest. E.g. 'Are you ready to do x' or 'See how it works'
Get quickly to the point with direct & compeling phrases.
Multiple CTA's can be used for each section
Use images/video with a header and concise explanation.
Use bullet points if the feature is too big to explain and add a link for a detailed explanation in case the visitor is interested.
Talk about how it will benefit your customer. Make it about your customer, not your product.
Explain how the visitor can use it.
State your mission.
Ideally show all your employees.
Linkedin links for leadership roles can help build trust.
Highlight the best benefits.
Experiment with pricing over time.
Offer only a few plans.
Add an FAQ to the pricing page.
Highlight the recommended plan
Make the CTA prominent in each plan
Offer discounts when offering monthly vs annual plans
Use the questions you get from customers and use their wording when possible.
Don't answer one big question. Divide it into multiple smaller ones
Remember to add simple questions that might seem obvious to you.
Showcase expertise.
Make it seem personalized
Use logos and/or faces
If using faces, tell your visitors who they are and what they do for credibility.
If you also have case studies to go along with the testimonials have a CTA that directs them there
Data and statistics can also be used such as how many customers use you.
Use the footer to navigate to other parts of the site such as careers and blog.
Add relevant social links here.
Keep the design simple.
Included privacy policy and terms of service.
